facility.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a special part of a piece of equipment or a system which makes it possible to do something
facility.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Is there a call-back facility on this phone?
a bank account with an overdraft facility
facility.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a place or building used for a particular activity or industry, or for providing a particular type of service
facility.translation[0].definitions[1].e: the finest indoor sports facility in the US
facility.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a natural ability to do something easily and well
facility.translation[0].definitions[2].e: She has an amazing facility for languages.

facility.translation[1].definitions[0].d: special buildings or equipment that have been provided for a particular use, such as sports activities, shopping or travelling
facility.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The hotel’s leisure facilities include a large indoor pool, sauna and sun terrace.
facility.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a place or large building that is used to make or provide a particular product or service
facility.translation[1].definitions[1].e: Torness Harbour has the best permanent docking facility on Scotland’s south-east coast.
facility.translation[1].definitions[2].d: an arrangement made by a bank for its customers which lets them use the services the bank offers. These services would include, for example, borrowing or investing money
facility.translation[1].definitions[2].e: MIT has put in place a £20 millionloan facility for investment in European bonds.
The company has now secured new credit facilities to finance the purchase of the oilfield.
facility.translation[1].definitions[3].d: a special feature of a piece of equipment that allows it to do certain useful things, in addition to the things the equipment normally does
facility.translation[1].definitions[3].e: IBM have urged businesses to increase their back-up facilities (=systems that can be used if the main one stops working).
